x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Small-scale farmers in vulnerable regions lose huge amounts of crops every year due to unpredictable weather, pests, and poor soil health. They lack access to simple, real-time advice and struggle to prove their crops are sustainable and safe (e.g., pesticide-free) to potential buyers, keeping them locked in poverty.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

A platform that gives farmers personalized, science-backed advice and creates a transparent, auditable digital passport for their harvest:

  • Mobile App & Simple Intake: Farmers submit basic data (crop type, planting date) via a simple mobile app, even with basic internet connectivity.
  • IoT/IntegrationHub: Pulls and integrates data from weather APIs, satellite soil moisture data, and local pest infestation reports.
  • AI-Driven Advice: Now Assist analyzes the combined data and sends the farmer simple, actionable advice via text/app notification: "Risk of early blight is high. Apply fungicide tomorrow," or "Do not irrigate for two more days."
  • Supply Chain Auditing (Custom Tables): Creates an immutable, digital record of the crop's journey and any chemicals used, allowing major food buyers to confidently purchase verified sustainable produce.
